text: Henry John Slater (15 February 1839 – 4 November 1905) was an English first- class cricketer. Slater was born in February 1839 at Newark, Nottinghamshire. He played minor matches for Newark and Grantham, before making a single appearance in first-class cricket for the North against Surrey at The Oval in 1860, batting once in the North's first-innings and making an unbeaten 8 runs. He died at Newark in November 1905. ==References== ==External links== * Category:1839 births Category:1905 deaths Category:People from Newark-on-Trent Category:English cricketers Category:North v South cricketers
title: Henry Slater (cricketer, born 1839)
